body: It looks almost like [overriding a fixture with a parameter](https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/fixture.html#override-a-fixture-with-direct-test-parametrization), except that in my case nothing is overridden (there is no fixture named "argument")
i believe its exactly that and we should elevate it to a actual feature

> i believe its exactly that and we should elevate it to a actual feature

Really? I personally find it quite confusing. Seems more like an unintended side-effect, which will be hard to carry over when we start refactoring the underlying fixture implementation.
Hi! Is there still a need to work on this issue?

@nicoddemus in that case we probably need to make the indirect a required argument there

as  for fixtures, we will need to include a mechanism to distinguish between declared with params, declared as must be configured with params, declared as not having params (to enable better failing)

Hi! Could someone take a look at this commit on my fork of pytest?
I'm aware of fact this is far away from production-ready code, but just to check if the direction is right. 
https://github.com/erheron/pytest/commit/89086a13f7f6faafd24da236b2a6e88468c3f17f
The main issue is I don't really know where to put this enforcement we're talking about. Current proposition is `_src/python.py,` but I've started to think about `_src/fixtures.py` - for example function like `_getnextfixturedef()` raise `FixtureLookupError` when parameters are marked as **indirect** explicitly, so maybe this is the way to go?

issue.title: [parametrize] enforce explicit argnames declaration

repository.name: pytest
repository.description: The pytest framework makes it easy to write small tests, yet scales to support complex functional testing

issue.body:
<!--
Thanks for submitting a PR, your contribution is really appreciated!

Here is a quick checklist that should be present in PRs.

- [ ] Target the `master` branch for bug fixes, documentation updates and trivial changes.
- [ ] Target the `features` branch for new features, improvements, and removals/deprecations.
- [ ] Include documentation when adding new features.
- [ ] Include new tests or update existing tests when applicable.

Unless your change is trivial or a small documentation fix (e.g., a typo or reword of a small section) please:

- [ ] Create a new changelog file in the `changelog` folder, with a name like `<ISSUE NUMBER>.<TYPE>.rst`. See [changelog/README.rst](https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/blob/master/changelog/README.rst) for details.

  Write sentences in the **past or present tense**, examples:

  * *Improved verbose diff output with sequences.*
  * *Terminal summary statistics now use multiple colors.*

  Also make sure to end the sentence with a `.`.

- [ ] Add yourself to `AUTHORS` in alphabetical order.
-->
Hi, 

that's my first PR, ref. issue #5712 
The purpose of this is to enforce that every argument used in `parametrize` is explicitly declared either by corresponding test function or via `indirect` list. The example of how this is intended to work is given in documentation (added few lines to *doc/en/example/parametrize.rst*)
I target master branch because I consider it a small change/bugfix.

body: JFI: a PR is being worked on at https://github.com/pytest-dev/pytest/pull/6330  (for email notifications)
